br.usp.poli.takiyama.common
Class StdFactor

java.lang.Object
  br.usp.poli.takiyama.common.StdFactor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Factor, java.lang.Iterable<Tuple<RangeElement>>
public class StdFactor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Factor

Factors are table representations for joint distributions.

In order to save space, factors do not store all tuples, only their values. Values are indexed based on the order of variables (columns) and the order of the range of each variable.

Author:
ftakiyama

public static Factor getInstance(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.util.List<? extends Prv> variables,
                                 java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> values)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a parameterized factor.

The order of values is dependent on the order of the list of PRVs and their ranges.

Parameters:
name - The name of this factor
variables - A ordered list of Prv.
values - A ordered list of Number, determined by the order of Prvs.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of values specified is not compatible with the PRVs specified.

iterator

public static java.util.Iterator<Tuple<RangeElement>> iterator(java.util.List<Prv> variables)
Returns an iterator over all tuples of a parameterized factor having the specified variables.

The tuples returned depend on the order of the give parameterized random variable list, that is, the order of parameterized random variables define the way the tuples are created.

Parameters:
variables - A list of parameterized random variables.
Returns:
An iterator over all tuples of a parameterized factor having the specified parameterized random variables.

isSubFactorOf

public boolean isSubFactorOf(Factor factor)
Returns true if this factor is a sub-factor of the specified factor.

Factor F1 is a sub-factor of factor F2 if the set of Prvs from F1 is a subset of the of Prvs from F2.

Specified by:

sumOut

public Factor sumOut(Prv prv)
Sums out a random variable from a factor.

Suppose F is a factor on random variables x1,..., xi,...,xj. The summing out of random variable xi from F, denoted as ΣxiF is the factor on random variables x1,...,xi-1, xi+1, ..., xj such that

(Σxi F) (x1,...,xi-1,xi+1,...,xj) = Σ y ∈ dom(xi) F(x1,...,xi-1,xi = y, xi+1,...,xj).

If the variable to be summed out does not exist in the factor, this method returns the specified factor unmodified.

Specified by:
sumOut in interface Factor
Parameters:
prv - The Prv to be summed out.
Returns:
A factor with the specified Prv summed out, or this factor if prv does not exist in this factor.

pow

public Factor pow(int p,
                  int q)
Returns this factor raised by p/q.

Raising a factor to some exponent is the same as raising its values to that exponent.

Specified by:
pow in interface Factor
Parameters:
p - Exponents's numerator
q - Exponenet's denominator
Returns:
The value of this factor raised to p/q

multiply

public Factor multiply(Factor factor)
Multiplies this factor with the specified factor.

Given two factors F1(x1,...,xn, y1,...,yj) and F2(y1,...,yj, z1,...,zk) the resulting factor will be F(x1,...,xn,y1,..., yj,z1,...,zk) = F1(x1,...,xn,y1,..., yj) x F2(y1,...,yj,z1,..., zk)

That is, for each assignment of values to the variables in the factors, the method multiply the values that have the same assignment for common variables.

Specified by:
multiply in interface Factor
Parameters:
secondFactor - The second factor to be multiplied
Returns:
The multiplication of fisrtFactor by secondFactor.

reorder

public Factor reorder(Factor reference)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: Factor
Returns this factor reordered using the specified factor as a reference. The returned factor will have the same Prv order as the reference, with values reordered in order to not modify the distribution it represents.

Specified by:
reorder in interface Factor
Parameters:
reference - A reference factor that dictates the new PRV order
Returns:
This factor reordered using the specified factor as a reference.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the reference does not have the same PRVs as this factor.
